verses.text: Praise ye the \sc Lord\sc*. Praise the \sc Lord\sc*, O my soul.
While I live will I praise the \sc Lord\sc*: I will sing \add praises\add* unto my God while I have \add any\add* being.
Put not your trust in princes, \add Nor\add* in the son of man, in whom \add there is\add* no help.
His breath goeth forth, he returneth to his earth; In that \add very\add* day his thoughts perish.
Happy \add is he\add* that \add hath\add* the God of Jacob for his help, Whose hope \add is\add* in the \sc Lord\sc* his God:
Which made heaven, and earth, The sea, and all that therein is: Which keepeth truth for ever:
Which executeth judgment for the oppressed: Which giveth food to the hungry. The \sc Lord\sc* looseth the prisoners:
The \sc Lord\sc* openeth \add the eyes of\add* the blind: The \sc Lord\sc* raiseth them that are bowed down: The \sc Lord\sc* loveth the righteous:
The \sc Lord\sc* preserveth the strangers; He relieveth the fatherless and widow: But the way of the wicked he turneth upside down.
The \sc Lord\sc* shall reign for ever, \add Even\add* thy God, O Zion, unto all generations. Praise ye the \sc Lord\sc*.
